block.p: Hadley Rowena Gilman, the daughter of Sondra Gilman Gonzalez-Falla of New York and the late Charles Gilman Jr., was married last evening to David Brian Goerk, a son of Coralie and Jay B. Goerk of Manasquan, N.J. Bentley Kassal, a retired judge who was with the Appellate Division of the State Supreme Court in Manhattan, officiated at the home of the bride's mother and stepfather, Celso Gonzalez-Falla, in New York.

Ms. Gilman, 33, who is keeping her name, is the assistant director of the Laurence Miller Gallery, a photography gallery in New York. Her father was the president of the Gilman Paper Company in St. Mary's, Ga. Her mother is the chairwoman and her stepfather is the president of Soncel Inc., a real estate development company in Kingsland, Ga. The bride's mother and stepfather are also chairwoman and president of two New York organizations, the Sondra and Charles Gilman Jr. Foundation, which supports the arts, education and health, and the Gilman and Gonzalez-Falla Theater Foundation.

Hadley Rowena Gilman, the daughter of Sondra Gilman Gonzalez-Falla of New York and the late Charles Gilman Jr., was married last evening to David Brian Goerk, a son of Coralie and Jay B. Goerk of Manasquan, N.J. Bentley Kassal, a retired judge who was with the Appellate Division of the State Supreme Court in Manhattan, officiated at the home of the bride's mother and stepfather, Celso Gonzalez-Falla, in New York.

Ms. Gilman, 33, who is keeping her name, is the assistant director of the Laurence Miller Gallery, a photography gallery in New York. Her father was the president of the Gilman Paper Company in St. Mary's, Ga. Her mother is the chairwoman and her stepfather is the president of Soncel Inc., a real estate development company in Kingsland, Ga. The bride's mother and stepfather are also chairwoman and president of two New York organizations, the Sondra and Charles Gilman Jr. Foundation, which supports the arts, education and health, and the Gilman and Gonzalez-Falla Theater Foundation.

The bridegroom, 47, is the exhibitions manager at PaceWildenstein, an art gallery in New York. He is also an artist. He graduated from the Philadelphia College of Art and received a Master of Fine Arts degree from Indiana University. His father retired as the president of the former Abbott's Dairy Company in Philadelphia. The bridegroom's mother is a founder of the Women's Exchange, a consignment shop for handicrafts formerly in Ridgewood, N.J.
